com.rambilight.core.api

Class Global

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rambilight.core.api.Global

  • public class Global
extends java.lang.Object
    Global class for easy handling of global variables. It's not recommended to use these values directly, since parts like the LightHandler applies compensation for the compression level.

    Only use these values if absolutely necessary. See the LightHandler class for a more efficient way of using most these value.

      • compressionAutoSet

      • compressionLevel

        public static int compressionLevel
        The amount of compression which is applied to the data using a simple algorithm that only takes every n:th lights and fills the gap with a color related to the nearest neighbours.

      • currentControllers

        public static java.lang.String[] currentControllers

      • disableErrorPopups

        public static boolean disableErrorPopups

      • ERRORLOG

        public static final java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ERRORLOG

      • isActive

        public static boolean isActive
        Is the application active? WARNING: If set to false manually, the user might get confused. Only change this value if you know what you are doing.

      • isSerialConnectionActive

        public static boolean isSerialConnectionActive

      • lightLayout

        public static int[] lightLayout
        The light layout of the screen, in order of which they appear. This only effects modules which require control over specific sides of the screen, not only which light is active.

        Example: {15, 30, 15, 30}; This says that the first side has 15 lights, the second has 30, the third 15 and the forth 30.

      • lightLayoutClockwise

        public static boolean lightLayoutClockwise
        The direction of which the lights get addressed. This only effects modules which require control over specific sides of the screen, not only which light is active.

      • lightLayoutStartingPosition

        public static int lightLayoutStartingPosition
        The starting position of which the lights get addressed. This only effects modules which require control over specific sides of the screen, not only which light is active.

      • lightStepSize

        public static int lightStepSize

      • numLights

        public static int numLights
        The number of lights which are available, calculated from the light layout.

      • requestExit

        public static boolean requestExit
        If set to true, the application will try to exit gracefully.

      • serialPort

        public static java.lang.String serialPort

      • VERSION

        public static final int VERSION
        The version number of the API and application.
